info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 6:35PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Daniel Island to Whitehall Terrance, Awendaw and McClellanville. As much as 1 to 4 inches of rain has fallen over parts of the area this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Motorists traveling US-17 near Awendaw should remain alert for significant ponding of water on the road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, McClellanville, Daniel Island, Downtown Charleston, Isle Of Palms, Awendaw, Garris Landing, Bull Island, Price Inlet, Capers Inlet, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Lighthouse Island, Wando, Cainhoy, Cape Romain, Boone Hall Plantation and Cape Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
